1.text: The Elder to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in truth!

2.text: beloved, concerning all things I desire thee to prosper, and to be in health, even as thy soul doth prosper,

3.text: for I rejoiced exceedingly, brethren coming and testifying of the truth in thee, even as thou in truth dost walk;

4.text: greater than these things I have no joy, that I may hear of my children in truth walking.

5.text: Beloved, faithfully dost thou do whatever thou mayest work to the brethren and to the strangers,

6.text: who did testify of thy love before an assembly, whom thou wilt do well, having sent forward worthily of God,

7.text: because for His name they went forth, nothing receiving from the nations;

8.text: we, then, ought to receive such, that fellow-workers we may become to the truth.

9.text: I did write to the assembly, but he who is loving the first place among them—Diotrephes—doth not receive us;

10.text: because of this, if I may come, I will cause him to remember his works that he doth, with evil words prating against us; and not content with these, neither doth he himself receive the brethren, and those intending he doth forbid, and out of the assembly he doth cast.

11.text: Beloved, be not thou following that which is evil, but that which is good; he who is doing good, of God he is, and he who is doing evil hath not seen God;

12.text: to Demetrius testimony hath been given by all, and by the truth itself, and we also—we do testify, and ye have known that our testimony is true.

13.text: Many things I had to write, but I do not wish through ink and pen to write to thee,

14.text: and I hope straightway to see thee, and mouth to mouth we shall speak. Peace to thee! salute thee do the friends; be saluting the friends by name.
